item.description:
We'll be taking "the road less travelled" to the top of Mount Washington - ascent via the Great Gulf, descent via Boott Spur.

In my book, the scenery in the Great Gulf is unsurpassed in the White Mountains.

Distance is ~13 miles. Gain is over 5,000'. The pace will be fast. This is an advanced level hike. Some participants are training for a Pemi Loop or Presi Traverse at sub-book pace.

We will tarry on top ~30 minutes for obligatory summit shots and soft-serve ice cream.

If time and energy permit, we may skip over to Lakes of the Clouds via the Crawford Path, bag Monroe, and then take the Camel Trail back to the Davis Path, which we'll then take to the Boott Spur. That would add 2+ miles to the total distance.

We may spread out - you should be prepared to be self sufficient w/regard to gear and route finding.

Cross posted with the Maine Outdoor Adventure Club and listed on Views from the Top.

Due to the pace, distance and elevation gain, I am screening for this hike - if interested, please get on the waiting list and contact me! Thank you!
item.name: Mt Washington, maybe Monroe...DATE CHANGED to Sunday!
